metadata.description: Hybrid metrics taxonomy combining MAPS-aligned measurement discipline with probabilistic modeling and contextual intelligence for Medical Affairs Intelligence Platform
metadata.design_philosophy: Merge claim-bounded measurement (v3.0) with simulation-ready distributions (v2.1) for both compliance and optimization
design_principles: Confidence-by-region to avoid inferred data maturity
Probabilistic distributions for simulation and forecasting
ROI attribution and strategic criticality modeling
refactor_notes: Fixed linked_pillar_ids: replaced evidence_dissemination with scientific_exchange in publication_citation_impact
Added cascade.linked_tactic_ids to improve semantic interconnection

cascade_contract.description: Defines how metrics receive constraints from pillars/tactics/stakeholders and enable measurement reporting

tactic_families.mechanism: Metrics bound to specific tactic families; tactics declare required_metric_levels

pillar_ids_or_tags.mechanism: Metrics support pillar measurement; pillars declare minimum_metric_level_required

stakeholder_category_keys.mechanism: Metrics bound by stakeholder measurement ceilings; prevents over-claiming

metric_definition.definition: A composite index measuring the extent to which medical affairs activities have influenced actual clinical practice patterns, treatment guidelines, and healthcare provider behavior
metric_definition.calculation_method: Weighted composite of: (1) Guideline citation rate (35%), (2) Prescribing behavior change in target segments (30%), (3) Treatment protocol adoption (20%), (4) Medical education impact (10%), (5) Real-world evidence uptake (5%)
metric_definition.interpretation: Measures ultimate impact on clinical practice. Scores >70 indicate substantial practice influence; 50-70 moderate influence; <50 limited influence
metric_definition.clinical_relevance: The ultimate measure of medical affairs success - changing how medicine is practiced
metric_definition.business_relevance: Direct predictor of market access success, prescriber adoption, and long-term product success

maps_measurement.measurement_notes: Impact-level metric representing the pinnacle of medical affairs measurement - actual practice change

data_provenance.collection_method: Multi-source data integration: Claims analysis for prescribing patterns, guideline database monitoring, treatment protocol surveys, medical education impact assessments

UK.notes: NHS data provides strong prescribing signal; NICE guideline tracking

EU.notes: Variable data access across member states

US.notes: Comprehensive claims data and prescribing analytics available

typical_cost_per_point_improvement.note: USD to improve practice influence score by 1 point (high investment required)

estimated_roi_multiplier.note: Ultimate ROI metric - practice influence drives long-term value

governance.notes: Ultimate impact metric for medical affairs; requires C-suite visibility

metric_definition.definition: A composite score measuring the degree to which key opinion leaders actively support and advocate for the product or therapeutic approach
metric_definition.calculation_method: Weighted composite of: (1) Speaking/presentation frequency (30%), (2) Publication authorship (25%), (3) Social media advocacy (15%), (4) Guideline committee participation (20%), (5) Peer recommendation score from surveys (10%)
metric_definition.interpretation: Higher scores indicate stronger KOL advocacy and influence. Scores >75 indicate active advocacy; 50-75 neutral; <50 indicate limited or negative sentiment
metric_definition.clinical_relevance: KOL advocacy drives treatment adoption and shapes clinical practice patterns
metric_definition.business_relevance: Strong predictor of market share growth and prescriber behavior change

maps_measurement.measurement_notes: Outcome-level metric that can support impact claims when correlated with prescribing behavior or guideline adoption

data_provenance.collection_method: Quarterly KOL surveys combined with automated tracking of publications, speaking, and digital presence

oncology.note: High KOL engagement and advocacy culture

typical_cost_per_point_improvement.note: USD to improve advocacy index by 1 point

estimated_roi_multiplier.note: Each dollar spent on KOL engagement returns 6.5x in value

governance.notes: Strategic KOL performance metric with direct business impact

metric_definition.definition: The proportion of planned MSL engagements that were successfully completed within a given time period
metric_definition.calculation_method: (Number of completed engagements / Number of planned engagements) × 100
metric_definition.interpretation: Higher values indicate better execution of engagement plans and stakeholder accessibility
metric_definition.clinical_relevance: Leading indicator of stakeholder relationship strength and field medical team effectiveness
metric_definition.business_relevance: Measures operational efficiency of MSL resources and identifies access barriers

maps_measurement.measurement_notes: Activity-level metric that can support output claims about reach but cannot directly claim outcome or impact

data_provenance.collection_method: Automated CRM tracking with manual validation

EU.notes: Good CRM infrastructure; minor country variability

Eastern_Europe.notes: CRM adoption improving; some manual tracking gaps

SE_Asia_Emerging.notes: CRM infrastructure developing; high manual component

primary_care.note: Access challenges due to high volume

typical_cost_per_point_improvement.note: USD to improve engagement rate by 1 percentage point

metric_definition.definition: The average number of citations received by publications within 12 months of publication, weighted by journal impact factor
metric_definition.interpretation: Higher values indicate greater scientific impact and uptake of published research. Values >50 indicate high impact; 25-50 moderate impact; <25 limited impact
metric_definition.clinical_relevance: Citation rates indicate scientific community acceptance and influence on clinical thinking
metric_definition.business_relevance: Strong predictor of guideline influence, HCP awareness, and competitive scientific positioning

maps_measurement.measurement_notes: Outcome-level metric; can support impact claims when linked to guideline citations or practice change

data_provenance.collection_method: Automated tracking via Web of Science, Scopus, and PubMed Central APIs

typical_cost_per_point_improvement.note: USD to improve citation impact by 1 point

estimated_roi_multiplier.note: Publication investment ROI varies by journal tier and therapy area

governance.notes: Key measure of scientific impact and competitive positioning

metric_definition.definition: Percentage of priority stakeholders reached at least once within the measurement period, segmented by stakeholder type and channel.
metric_definition.calculation_method: (Unique priority stakeholders with >=1 compliant scientific interaction in period) / (Total priority stakeholder universe) * 100
inclusions: compliant scientific interactions (field, remote, digital) logged in CRM/engagement platform
exclusions: non-consented digital impressions where consent required

maps_measurement.maps_alignment_notes: Coverage/reach is a foundational output metric; should be paired with quality and outcomes metrics to avoid over-weighting volume.

known_limitations: varying consent and tracking rules by region

statistical_model.notes: Beta distribution reflects bounded percentage outcomes; parameters are default priors and should be recalibrated with client historical data.

short_term_6m.notes: Initial reach build-out during early execution; adjust by therapy area and market.

mid_term_12m.notes: Expected with stable omnichannel and field cadence.

long_term_24m.notes: Requires mature segmentation and sustained engagement quality.

benchmarks.benchmark_notes: Public sources discuss reach/coverage as common MA KPI but do not standardize numeric benchmarks; ranges are synthetic priors for simulation only.

classification_thresholds.notes: Thresholds are defaults and should be tuned to stakeholder universe size and channel mix.

roi_attribution.notes: Use as an efficiency/coverage KPI; avoid direct causality claims to sales or prescribing without appropriate study design.

governance.compliance_notes: Ensure interaction classification and consent requirements are met and auditable by region.
